answers.answer: The National curative health programs represent a set of actions focused on treatment, aiming to ensure specific treatment for diseases with a major impact on public health.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: These programs function by providing specific treatment, including medicine, sanitary materials, medical devices, specific services like radiotherapy and dialysis, and specific investigations depending on the treated condition.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The National Health Insurance House (CNAS) manages and implements the national curative health programs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medical support includes medicine, sanitary materials, medical devices, specific services (e.g., radiotherapy, dialysis), and specific investigations (e.g., glycosylated hemoglobin dosage, PET-CT). For chronic renal failure, non-medicalized transport and monthly transport of medicines/materials are also provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medicines are obtained through community pharmacies (open-circuit) or hospital pharmacies (closed-circuit), based on the specific condition, and only those included in the List of compensated medicines approved by Government Decision are provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: A specialist doctor can decide to enroll a patient based on their condition, health state, and eligibility criteria. Patients must contact a specialist doctor working in a health unit that runs the respective program.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program'.

answers.answer: A specialist doctor decides on patient enrollment based on eligibility criteria, prescribes the treatment, and is the point of contact for patients seeking to benefit from the program.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program'.

answers.answer: The programs cover conditions such as cardiovascular diseases, oncology, deafness, diabetes, neurological diseases, hemophilia, thalassemia, rare diseases, mental health, endocrine diseases, orthopedics, organ/tissue/cell transplantation, chronic renal failure, and liver failure.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The National curative health programs primarily focus on treatment, in contrast to national public health programs which emphasize prevention.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals can find the list of health facilities on the web pages of the health insurance companies, in the "Information for insured people" - "National Curative Health Programs" section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program'.
